channel.title: Grammar help :(
channel.description:
Hey. Can someone classify these sentences(identify verb, Subject noun, etc.)?
during the summer clumps of weeds grow in abundance along the river's edge.
Jason and Justing grinned broadly and waited patiently for the final scene of the play.
That amazing football player was not sent to the sidelines for the entire season.

item.title: Grammar help :(
item.dc:creator: @script_owned4 script_owned4
item.description:
@script_owned4 wrote:

Nouns

summer,clumps,weeds,river’s edge,Jason,Justing,scence,play,football player,sidelines,season.

Subject Noun

football

Read full topic

item.title: Grammar help :(
item.dc:creator: @LegendaryLoser .Flair
item.description:
@LegendaryLoser wrote:

( P A OP ) SN (P OP) V (P OP) (P A Adj/PPA OP)
During the summer clumps of weeds /grow in abundance along the river’s edge. D

Cant be bothered with the rest

Read full topic

item.title: Grammar help :(
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

During the summer is a prepositional phrase (?)
clumps is the subject.
of weeds is a prepositional phrase.
grow is the verb.
in abundance is a prepositional phrase.
along the river’s edge is a prepositional phrase.

Jason, Justin are the subjects.
grinned is a verb.
broadly is an adverb.
and is a conjunction.
waited is the second verb.
patiently is an adverb.
for the final scene is a prepositional phrase.
of the play is a prepositional phrase.

That is a distal demonstrative determiner.
amazing, football are adjectives.
player is the subject/noun.
was sent is the verb (?).
not is the not.
to the sidelines is a prepositional phrase.
for the entire season is a prepositional phrase.

Read full topic

item.title: Grammar help :(

item.description:
@Larenzo wrote:

during the summer clumps of weeds grow in abundance along the river’s edge.

Jason and Justing grinned broadly and waited patiently for the final scene of the play.

That amazing football player was not sent to the sidelines for the entire season.

Verbs
Grow,grinned,waited,sent
